text: hi I'm Melissa Clark from the dining
section and I am here to tempt you this
Thanksgiving I want you to make your own
pie first you've got to make the dough
that's the hard part that's the part
that puts most people off they think I
can't make pie dough it never comes out
flaky when I make it I'm going to show
you how to make it really flaky
you've got your flour and your salt in
the food processor next step is to put
in your fat you have choices here all
butter crust are my favorite it has a
really rich flavor and a really good
homemade pie crust you can also add a
little bit of lard or Crisco to get that
flakiness lard by far is your best
choice it has no flavor all it has is a
lightness that really makes a big
difference it gives it a big crunch so
this is what you do first step you want
to put your fat into the food processor
and you want to cut it in until it's big
chunks most cookbooks say pea sized
chunks but I'm here to say ah see that
chunk that's the size of chunks you're
looking for pea sized chunks are just
too small you need big chunks I'm
talking a lima bean size chunks after
you've got your lima bean size pieces
stop processing and add your ice water
tablespoon buy tablespoon about three or
four as soon as it comes together stop
processing you are done pour it out onto
the counter push it together with your
hands wrap it in a little bit of saran
wrap in the fridge until you're ready to
roll it out you can do pie crust three
days ahead now when it comes to rolling
pie dough most people roll and roll and
roll roll it right into the counter and
then they can't get it off there's a
trick to it sprinkle a little flour
right on the counter roll it and then
move it you keep rolling and moving
flipping it over adding a little more
flour as you go and that way it never
sticks because you never keep it in the
same position once you've got your dough
nice and flat you want to just drape it
over itself and lay it gently on the pie
dish and then you flute it which is
really easy
the thing about fluting it doesn't have
to look that good once you put it in the
oven and it turns golden brown and kind
of melts into itself it looks gorgeous
so don't stress out the fluting part one
thing that is different about the pie
crust recipe that I like to use is
double baking the bottom crust so you
take a big piece of foil put it right on
top of your crust press it in and then
put pie weights on top I like to use
pennies because pennies are made out of
copper or they used to be made out of
copper and they are great conductors of
heat so they give you a really nice even
brown crust then you pop it in the oven
get it really brown and when it's done
and it's cool then you add your
and you will let another ball of dough
until it's nice and flat then you want
to trim it so it fits right on top of
your crust and then you lift it up and
drape it over your apples tuck the edges
in and then slash it all around for air
vents you can make this decorative or
you can just be really simple and
playing like that the last step to get
the most golden beautiful looking pie
you want to brush it with something like
milk or heavy cream whatever you've got
so you just take a little milk on your
brush brush it all around and if you
really want to knock people's socks off
and you want the entire house to smell
amazing while this pie is baking even
more amazing that it would anyway
cinnamon sugar just take some cinnamon
sugar sprinkle it right on the top in
the oven 50 minutes later heaven in a
pie crust
you
